Additional Comparative Futility Stopping Rule Based on Bayesian', 'Approach', 'If both arms pass the futility boundaries based on group sequential design described', 'above, posterior probability of observing a better RR in one arm relative to the other will', 'be calculated. If such a probability is at least 97.5%, then the treatment arm with lower', 'RR will be dropped due to lack of efficacy. This additional guidance was put in to allow', 'for dropping an arm with substantially inferior response rates (e.g. absolute difference', '>', '28%).', 'To calculate the posterior probability, a non-informative Beta prior (0.025, 0.1) will be', 'used for each arm.
